action: I want to submit applications for reimbursed transportation and business expenses through the correct approval flow
reason: To receive reimbursement according to company regulations and ensure accurate accounting processing
acceptance_criteria: Expense application is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with application creation authority can use the function.
Application IDs are automatically numbered and unique.
The applicant's User ID is automatically linked to the application.
Selection of expense type (Transportation / Lodging / Supplies / Entertainment, etc.) is mandatory.
Expense type master data is updateable from the management screen.
The amount must be input as numeric only.
The amount must be greater than 0.
Currency units are controllable via settings.
Future dates cannot be entered for the occurrence date.
Occurrence date is a mandatory input.
Reason for application is mandatory (minimum 10 characters).
Attachment of receipt files is possible.
Attachment file formats are restricted to PDF / JPG / PNG.
Attachment file size limit is 10MB.
Files are stored only if they pass a virus scan.
The file storage destination is encrypted storage.
Attachment file URLs are retrievable only via signed URLs.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Application creation is completed within a DB transaction.
Application fails if mandatory items are missing.
Application fails if invalid data types are entered.
Application status is restricted to Draft / Submitted / Approved / Rejected.
Only applications in the Draft state can be edited.
The applicant cannot edit the application after it is Submitted.
The approval flow starts upon submission.
Approval routes are automatically determined by organizational hierarchy or amount.
Additional approval from upper management is added if the amount exceeds a threshold.
Only designated approvers can perform approve/reject operations.
Reason input is mandatory for both approve and reject operations.
Approval history is stored in chronological order.
Approval history includes User ID, operation, and timestamp.
A notification is sent to the applicant upon rejection.
A notification is sent to the accounting role upon approval completion.
Notifications are processed via asynchronous queues.
Application data is logically deletable.
Deletion is only possible with administrator authority.
Audit logs are stored upon deletion.
Application data change history is maintained.
Change history stores values before and after changes.
The same validation applies to applications via API.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Internal information is not returned during errors.
DB structure information is not included in the response.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Target response time for the application API is within 400ms.
